questions.question: According to the British, experiences at Front was supposed to be:

choices.answer: 4 days in front line; 4 days in support; 4-8 days in reserve
5 days in front line; 5 days in support; 5-9 days in reserve
6 days in front line 6 days in support; 6-10 days in reserve
7 days in front line 7 days in support; 7-11 days in reserve

questions.question: However, experiences for the British sometimes were a ____ or more on the frontline:

choices.answer: week
fortnight
month
year

questions.question: Germans however had a different routine, they spent:

choices.answer: 7 days on the frontline and 7 days in rest
8 days on the frontline and 8 days in rest
9 days on the frontline and 9 days in rest
10 days on the frontline and 10 days in rest

questions.question: "Stand to" usually happened at what times of day?

choices.answer: Morning & Night
Dawn & Night
Morning & Dusk
Dawn & Dusk

questions.question: Why did "stand to" happen at these times of day?

choices.answer: It was to get the soldiers up and ready
It was simply part of their routine
More likely for an attack to occur
To defend their trenches

questions.question: The Trench system was referred to as:

choices.answer: The one line trench system
The two line trench system
The three line trench system
The four line trench system

questions.question: What pattern were trenches in?

choices.answer: Circular
Curved
Straight
Zig-Zag

questions.question: Why were trenches in this pattern?

choices.answer: protect soldiers from shelling, make it difficult to capture
protect soldiers from shelling, make it easy to capture
Better form of defence
Better to run "over the top" from

questions.question: What were some common battle features?

choices.answer: Vast firepower, lots of men, months of planning,
Surprise attacks were difficult reconnaissance aircraft used
heavy artillery attacked the location to soften the trenches
Tactics led to high casualties, frontal assaults decimated

questions.question: Trench Features: What is a funk hole?

choices.answer: drainage
Sandbags
wooden boards
Shelter

questions.question: Trench Features: What was the parapet?

choices.answer: Sandbags piled at the front of the trench
Sandbags piled at the back of the trench
Wooden boards
Another name for barbed wire

questions.question: Trench Features: What was the parados?

choices.answer: Sandbags at the front of the trench
Wooden boards
Sandbags at the back of the trench
drainage

questions.question: Trench Features: What are duckboards?

choices.answer: Drainage to help reduce water from the trench
Wooden Boards to help soldier keep their feet dry
Barbed Wire
Shelter

questions.question: Trench Features: What is a firestep?

choices.answer: Sandbags
Step which allowed soldiers to shoot over the trench
Barbed wire
a step to "stand to" at dawn and dusk

questions.question: Trench Features: What is a sump?

choices.answer: toliet
drainage
A ditch in the trench
Nothing, it is a made up word

questions.question: Trench Features: What other two features were common parts of the trench?

choices.answer: Pillboxes and flamethrowers
Barbed wire and "Stand to" flags
Barbed Wire and Ammunition shelf
Ammunition shelf and Pillboxes

questions.question: German Trenches were usually built:

choices.answer: In chalky soil on higher ground
In chalky soil on lower ground
In dense soil on higher ground
In dense soil on lower ground

questions.question: British trenches were usually built:

choices.answer: On lower ground but better than the Germans
On higher ground and not as developed as the Germans
On higher ground and better than the Germans
On lower ground and not as developed as the Germans

questions.question: Some common problems suffered by soldiers in the trenches were:

choices.answer: Shellshock trench foot rats lice dysentery & other diseases
Shellshock, trench foot, rats & lice
Rats, lice, dysentery & other diseases
Shellshock, dysentery & other diseases

questions.question: Some weapons on the Western Front included:

choices.answer: Artillery, Gas, Machine Guns, hand grenades & tanks
Artillery, Gas, Machine Guns, Rifles, hand grenades & tanks
Artillery, Gas, Machine Guns, Rifles & tanks
Gas, Machine Guns, Rifles, hand grenades & tanks
